      Returns:

    • isAllDone

      private boolean isAllDone(List<Integer> list)
      Checks if all elements in the provided list are equal to the DONE value.
      Parameters:
      list - the list of integers to check
      Returns:
      true if all elements in the list are equal to DONE, false otherwise

    • triggerNextRound

      private void triggerNextRound()
      Advances the game to the next round in the MeteorsRainState. This method resets the rolled status for the dice, increments the index of the current meteor, and determines whether it is necessary to transition to the next game state. If all meteors have been processed, the `triggerNextState` method is called to handle the transition. Otherwise, the state of each player is reset to the INIT state in preparation for the next round.

    • rollDice

      public void rollDice(Player player) throws InvalidStateException
      Handles the roll dice action in the context of the MeteorsRainState. This method allows a player to roll the dice, determines the effect of the roll based on the current meteor's direction and attack specifications, and updates the game state accordingly.
      Overrides:
      rollDice in class GameState
      Parameters:
      player - the player who initiates the roll dice action
      Throws:
      InvalidStateException - if the action is not allowed for the player or the game state

    • fixShip

      public void fixShip(Player player, List<Coordinates> coordinatesList) throws InvalidStateException
      Fixes the ship of the given player by repairing the specified tiles. This method checks if the player is allowed to perform the fix operation and updates the game state based on the legality of the ship after the fix.
      Overrides:
      fixShip in class GameState
      Parameters:
      player - the player who is attempting to fix their ship
      coordinatesList - a list of coordinates representing the ship tiles to be repaired
      Throws:
      InvalidStateException - if the player is not allowed to fix their ship at this time

    • chooseBattery

      public void chooseBattery(Player player, int x, int y) throws InvalidStateException
      Allows a player to choose how to respond when their ship is under attack by a meteor. The player can either handle the hit by accepting the damage or use a battery to prevent damage.
      Overrides:
      chooseBattery in class GameState
      Parameters:
      player - the player making the decision to handle the attack
      x - the x-coordinate of the battery to be used; or -1 if the player chooses to take the hit
      y - the y-coordinate of the battery to be used; or -1 if the player chooses to take the hit
      Throws:
      InvalidStateException - if the player is not allowed to perform the choose battery action at this time

    • updateView

      public void updateView(View view, Game toDisplay) throws IOException
      Updates the given view with the current state of the provided game object.
      Overrides:
      updateView in class GameState
      Parameters:
      view - the view instance that should be updated
      toDisplay - the game object containing the state to render on the view
      Throws:
      IOException - if an input or output exception occurs during the view update
